required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intravenous Ascorbic Acid in Women Receiving Adjuvant or Neo-Adjuvant Chemotherapy for Early Stage Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Double Blind Study of the Effect of Intravenous High Dose Ascorbic Acid in Women Receiving Adjuvant or Neo-Adjuvant Chemotherapy for Early Stage Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This is a parallel-track, randomized study will observe whether intravenous ascorbic acid reduces the reported fatigue in women receiving adjuvant or neo-adjuvant chemotherapy for early stage breast cancer.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Manufacturer unwilling to provide information needed for IND application.

primary_outcome.measure: Fatigue by self reported fatigue inventory questionnaire
primary_outcome.description: Patients will complete the validated questionnaire Fatigue Symptom Inventory (FSI)

secondary_outcome.description: Patients will complete the validated questionnaire EORTC QLQ-FA13
Patients will complete the validated questionnaire EORTC QLQ-FA13
Patients will complete the validated questionnaire EORTC QLQ-FA13

secondary_outcome.measure: Fatigue by self reported fatigue inventory questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Patients will complete the validated questionnaire Fatigue Symptom Inventory (FSI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Fatigue by self reported fatigue inventory questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Patients will complete the validated questionnaire Fatigue Symptom Inventory (FSI)

arm_group.description: Women randomized to this study arm will receive intravenous ascorbic acid (50g in 500 ml sterile water) prior to their odd-numbered chemotherapy cycles. During the even-numbered chemotherapy cycles, these subjects will receive intravenous normal saline (0.9%).

Women randomized to this study arm will receive intravenous ascorbic acid (50g in 500 ml sterile water) prior to their even-numbered chemotherapy cycles. During the odd-numbered chemotherapy cycles, these subjects will receive intravenous normal saline (0.9%).

intervention.description: 500 g ascorbic acid dissolved in 500 ml sterile water.
